subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: ... So you re saying that we who have CLOTH = THOUGHT and LOT = PALM (a large minority of Americans and a small minority of Brits) should use Awe for the first
messageBody:
Anthony Grahn scripsit:

> 1. Use Awe for the THOUGHT, CLOTH and LOT lexical sets when they do
> not merge with PALM.

So you're saying that we who have CLOTH = THOUGHT and LOT = PALM (a
large minority of Americans and a small minority of Brits) should use
Awe for the first and Ah for the second, whereas those with CLOTH = LOT,
THOUGHT, PALM (current RP speakers) should use Awe for the first two and
Ah for the third, is that right? But what about CLOTH = LOT, THOUGHT
= PALM folks (most Canadians)? Are they too to use Awe for the first
and Ah for the second? Finally, what about Scottish English speakers,
who (IIRC) have CLOTH = THOUGHT, LOT, PALM?

(Remember that CLOTH is always either merged with THOUGHT or with LOT.)

--
It was dreary and wearisome. Cold clammy winter still held way in this
forsaken country. The only green was the scum of livid weed on the dark
greasy surfaces of the sullen waters. Dead grasses and rotting reeds loomed
up in the mists like ragged shadows of long-forgotten summers.
--"The Passage of the Marshes" http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
